livegrep

Fast, regular expression code search service
git clone https://source.static.kevinlin.info/external/livegrep.git

      1 $ = require('jquery');
      2 
      3 var KeyCodes = {
      4   ESCAPE: 27,
      5   ENTER: 13,
      6   SLASH_OR_QUESTION_MARK: 191
      7 };
      8 
      9 function getSelectedText() {
     10   return window.getSelection ? window.getSelection().toString() : null;
     11 }
     12 
     13 function scrollToRange(range, elementContainer) {
     14   // - If we have a single line, scroll the viewport so that the element is
     15   // at 1/3 of the viewport.
     16   // - If we have a range, try and center the range in the viewport
     17   // - If the range is to high to fit in the viewport, fallback to the single
     18   //   element scenario for the first line
     19   var viewport = $(window);
     20   var viewportHeight = viewport.height();
     21 
     22   var scrollOffset = Math.floor(viewport.height() / 3.0);
     23 
     24   var firstLineElement = elementContainer.find("#L" + range.start);
     25   if(!firstLineElement.length) {
     26     // We were given a scroll offset to a line number that doesn't exist in the page, bail
     27     return;
     28   }
     29   if(range.start != range.end) {
     30     // We have a range, try and center the entire range. If it's to high
     31     // for the viewport, fallback to revealing the first element.
     32     var lastLineElement = elementContainer.find("#L" + range.end);
     33     var rangeHeight = (lastLineElement.offset().top + lastLineElement.height()) - firstLineElement.offset().top;
     34     if(rangeHeight <= viewportHeight) {
     35       // Range fits in viewport, center it
     36       scrollOffset = 0.5 * (viewportHeight - rangeHeight);
     37     } else {
     38       scrollOffset = firstLineElement.height() / 2; // Stick to (almost) the top of the viewport
     39     }
     40   }
     41 
     42   viewport.scrollTop(firstLineElement.offset().top - scrollOffset);
     43 }
     44 
     45 function setHash(hash) {
     46   if(history.replaceState) {
     47     history.replaceState(null, null, hash);
     48   } else {
     49     location.hash = hash;
     50   }
     51 }
     52 
     53 function parseHashForLineRange(hashString) {
     54   var parseMatch = hashString.match(/#L(\d+)(?:-L?(\d+))?/);
     55 
     56   if(parseMatch && parseMatch.length === 3) {
     57     // We have a match on the regex expression
     58     var startLine = parseInt(parseMatch[1], 10);
     59     var endLine = parseInt(parseMatch[2], 10);
     60     if(isNaN(endLine) || endLine < startLine) {
     61       endLine = startLine;
     62     }
     63     return {
     64       start: startLine,
     65       end: endLine
     66     };
     67   }
     68 
     69   return null;
     70 }
     71 
     72 function addHighlightClassesForRange(range, root) {
     73   var idSelectors = [];
     74   for(var lineNumber = range.start; lineNumber <= range.end; lineNumber++) {
     75     idSelectors.push("#L" + lineNumber);
     76   }
     77   root.find(idSelectors.join(",")).addClass('highlighted');
     78 }
     79 
     80 function expandRangeToElement(element) {
     81   var range = parseHashForLineRange(document.location.hash);
     82   if(range) {
     83     var elementLine = parseInt(element.attr('id').replace('L', ''), 10);
     84     if(elementLine < range.start) {
     85       range.end = range.start;
     86       range.start = elementLine;
     87     } else {
     88       range.end = elementLine;
     89     }
     90     setHash("#L" + range.start + "-" + range.end);
     91   }
     92 }
     93 
     94 function init(initData) {
     95   var root = $('.file-content');
     96   var lineNumberContainer = root.find('.line-numbers');
     97   var helpScreen = $('.help-screen');
     98 
     99   function doSearch(event, query, newTab) {
    100     var url;
    101     if (query !== undefined) {
    102       url = '/search?q=' + encodeURIComponent(query) + '&repo=' + encodeURIComponent(initData.repo_info.name);
    103     } else {
    104       url = '/search';
    105     }
    106     if (newTab === true){
    107       window.open(url);
    108     } else {
    109       window.location.href = url
    110     }
    111   }
    112 
    113   function showHelp() {
    114     helpScreen.removeClass('hidden').children().on('click', function(event) {
    115       // Prevent clicks inside the element to reach the document
    116       event.stopImmediatePropagation();
    117       return true;
    118     });
    119 
    120     $(document).on('click', hideHelp);
    121   }
    122 
    123   function hideHelp() {
    124     helpScreen.addClass('hidden').children().off('click');
    125     $(document).off('click', hideHelp);
    126     return true;
    127   }
    128 
    129   function handleHashChange(scrollElementIntoView) {
    130     if(scrollElementIntoView === undefined) {
    131       scrollElementIntoView = true; // default if nothing was provided
    132     }
    133 
    134     // Clear current highlights
    135     lineNumberContainer.find('.highlighted').removeClass('highlighted');
    136 
    137     // Highlight the current range from the hash, if any
    138     var range = parseHashForLineRange(document.location.hash);
    139     if(range) {
    140       addHighlightClassesForRange(range, lineNumberContainer);
    141       if(scrollElementIntoView) {
    142         scrollToRange(range, root);
    143       }
    144     }
    145 
    146     // Update the external-browse link
    147     $('#external-link').attr('href', getExternalLink(range));
    148     updateFragments(range, $('#permalink, #back-to-head'));
    149   }
    150 
    151   function getLineNumber(range) {
    152     if (range == null) {
    153       // Default to first line if no lines are selected.
    154       return 1;
    155     } else if (range.start == range.end) {
    156       return range.start;
    157     } else {
    158       // We blindly assume that the external viewer supports linking to a
    159       // range of lines. Github doesn't support this, but highlights the
    160       // first line given, which is close enough.
    161       return range.start + "-" + range.end;
    162     }
    163   }
    164 
    165   function getExternalLink(range) {
    166     var lno = getLineNumber(range);
    167 
    168     var repoName = initData.repo_info.name;
    169     var filePath = initData.file_path;
    170 
    171     url = initData.repo_info.metadata['url_pattern'];
    172 
    173     // If url not found, warn user and fail gracefully
    174     if (!url) { // deal with both undefined and empty string
    175         console.error("The index file you provided does not provide repositories[x].metadata.url_pattern. External links to file sources will not work. See the README for more information on file viewing.");
    176         return;
    177     }
    178 
    179     // If {path} already has a slash in front of it, trim extra leading
    180     // slashes from `pathInRepo` to avoid a double-slash in the URL.
    181     if (url.indexOf('/{path}') !== -1) {
    182       filePath = filePath.replace(/^\/+/, '');
    183     }
    184 
    185     // XXX code copied
    186     url = url.replace('{lno}', lno);
    187     url = url.replace('{version}', initData.commit);
    188     url = url.replace('{name}', repoName);
    189     url = url.replace('{path}', filePath);
    190     return url;
    191   }
    192 
    193   function updateFragments(range, $anchors) {
    194     $anchors.each(function() {
    195       var $a = $(this);
    196       var href = $a.attr('href').split('#')[0];
    197       if (range !== null) {
    198         href += '#L' + getLineNumber(range);
    199       }
    200       $a.attr('href', href);
    201     });
    202   }
    203 
    204   function processKeyEvent(event) {
    205     if(event.which === KeyCodes.ENTER) {
    206       // Perform a new search with the selected text, if any
    207       var selectedText = getSelectedText();
    208       if(selectedText) {
    209         doSearch(event, selectedText, true);
    210       }
    211     } else if(event.which === KeyCodes.SLASH_OR_QUESTION_MARK) {
    212         event.preventDefault();
    213         if(event.shiftKey) {
    214           showHelp();
    215         } else {
    216           hideHelp();
    217           doSearch(event, getSelectedText());
    218         }
    219     } else if(event.which === KeyCodes.ESCAPE) {
    220       // Avoid swallowing the important escape key event unless we're sure we want to
    221       if(!helpScreen.hasClass('hidden')) {
    222         event.preventDefault();
    223         hideHelp();
    224       }
    225       $('#query').blur();
    226     } else if(String.fromCharCode(event.which) == 'V') {
    227       // Visually highlight the external link to indicate what happened
    228       $('#external-link').focus();
    229       window.location = $('#external-link').attr('href');
    230     } else if (String.fromCharCode(event.which) == 'Y') {
    231       var $a = $('#permalink');
    232       var permalink_is_present = $a.length > 0;
    233       if (permalink_is_present) {
    234         $a.focus();
    235         window.location = $a.attr('href');
    236       }
    237     } else if (String.fromCharCode(event.which) == 'N' || String.fromCharCode(event.which) == 'P') {
    238       var goBackwards = String.fromCharCode(event.which) === 'P';
    239       var selectedText = getSelectedText();
    240       if (selectedText) {
    241         window.find(selectedText, false /* case sensitive */, goBackwards);
    242       }
    243     }
    244     return true;
    245   }
    246 
    247   function initializeActionButtons(root) {
    248     // Map out action name to function call, and automate the details of actually hooking
    249     // up the event handling.
    250     var ACTION_MAP = {
    251       search: doSearch,
    252       help: showHelp,
    253     };
    254 
    255     for(var actionName in ACTION_MAP) {
    256       root.on('click auxclick', '[data-action-name="' + actionName + '"]',
    257         // We can't use the action mapped handler directly here since the iterator (`actioName`)
    258         // will keep changing in the closure of the inline function.
    259         // Generating a click handler on the fly removes the dependency on closure which
    260         // makes this work as one would expect. #justjsthings.
    261         (function(handler) {
    262           return function(event) {
    263             event.preventDefault();
    264             event.stopImmediatePropagation(); // Prevent immediately closing modals etc.
    265             handler.call(this, event);
    266           }
    267         })(ACTION_MAP[actionName])
    268       )
    269     }
    270   }
    271 
    272   var showSelectionReminder = function () {
    273     $('.without-selection').hide();
    274     $('.with-selection').show();
    275   }
    276 
    277   var hideSelectionReminder = function () {
    278     $('.without-selection').show();
    279     $('.with-selection').hide();
    280   }
    281 
    282   function initializePage() {
    283     // Initial range detection for when the page is loaded
    284     handleHashChange();
    285 
    286     // Allow shift clicking links to expand the highlight range
    287     lineNumberContainer.on('click', 'a', function(event) {
    288       event.preventDefault();
    289       if(event.shiftKey) {
    290         expandRangeToElement($(event.target), lineNumberContainer);
    291       } else {
    292         setHash($(event.target).attr('href'));
    293       }
    294       handleHashChange(false);
    295     });
    296 
    297     $(window).on('hashchange', function(event) {
    298       event.preventDefault();
    299       // The url was updated with a new range
    300       handleHashChange();
    301     });
    302 
    303     $(document).on('keydown', function(event) {
    304       // Filter out key events when the user has focused an input field.
    305       if($(event.target).is('input,textarea'))
    306         return;
    307       // Filter out key if a modifier is pressed.
    308       if(event.altKey || event.ctrlKey || event.metaKey)
    309         return;
    310       processKeyEvent(event);
    311     });
    312 
    313     $(document).mouseup(function() {
    314       var selectedText = getSelectedText();
    315       if(selectedText) {
    316         showSelectionReminder(selectedText);
    317       } else {
    318         hideSelectionReminder();
    319       }
    320     });
    321 
    322     initializeActionButtons($('.header .header-actions'));
    323   }
    324 
    325   // The native browser handling of hashes in the location is to scroll
    326   // to the element that has a name matching the id. We want to prevent
    327   // this since we want to take control over scrolling ourselves, and the
    328   // most reliable way to do this is to hide the elements until the page
    329   // has loaded. We also need defer our own scroll handling since we can't
    330   // access the geometry of the DOM elements until they are visible.
    331   setTimeout(function() {
    332     lineNumberContainer.css({display: 'block'});
    333     initializePage();
    334   }, 1);
    335 }
    336 
    337 module.exports = {
    338   init: init
    339 }
